text: French translation of the i18n message catalog for the Lenya GUI.

creator: olange@petit-atelier.ch
text:
Created attachment 11222
i18n message catalog in french (src/webapp/lenya/resources/i18n/)

Translation notes
  Main linguistic reference: EuroDicAutom, http://europa.eu.int/eurodicautom

  OPEN TRANSLATION ISSUES

  * Message with key="New document" translated to french as "Nouveau
    document", but is still shown in english in the File menu; this message
    key seems not being referenced by Lenya.

  * Messages with keys in { "Edit with Kupu", "Inherited Rights", "Meta",
    "Live", "Create new language version", "New language for existing
    Document", "User ID", "IP Range Groups" } were missing from cmsui.xml
    and were not translated; added here (cmsui_fr.xml).

  * The messages "There are already versions of this document for all
    languages." (action Authoring | File > New language version"),
    "The password must be at least six characters long.\nThe password must
    contain at least one number." (action Admin | New User > Submit),
    "This IP range already exists" (action Admin | New IP range > Submit)
    are not translated; I could not find the appropriate keys to add
    them here. May be are there other untranslated validation messages,
    I figured out some use cases, but not all.

  * Conflict with the meanings of the message with key="admin": it should
    be split into two keys. Within the "Site | CA Auth" form, in the context
    of the "role" column, "admin" should be translated as "administrer" (verb)
    in french; in the context of the "group" selection list, it should be
    translated as "administrateur" (noun). For now, I left "admin." in french.

    I suggest to define specific keys for these field values:
    message keys="ac-auth-role.values.visit|review|admin|edit"

  * Same problem for the message with key="review": conflicting meanings in the
    contexts of "Site | Workflow" vs "Site | CA Auth" forms: "réviser" should
    be displayed as "révision" in the context of the "Site | Workflow: Status",
    "réviser" in the context of "Site | CA Auth: Role".

    I suggest to define specific keys for these field values:
    message keys="workflow-status.value.edit|review|live"

  * Within the "Site | Schedule" form, for active jobs, the "Modify" and "Delete"
    buttons are not translated. There is a message key for "Delete", which is
    ignored, and no message key for "Modify". Same problem for jobs with
    expired dates: the "Delete" button is not translated.

  SPECIAL IDIOMS

  * "Server time" was translated with "Horodate", which means "Time stamp";
    it seems more accurate to me and "Temps serveur" is somewhat weird;
    does this "time stamp" meaning also fit the purpose of this message?

  * "Language version" was always translated with "traduction" ("translation"),
    i.e. "New language version" = "Nouvelle traduction"; "Remove language
    version" = "Supprimer la traduction", etc. I could not find a better
    short translation of "new language version". Translated acurately, it
    would be "Nouvelle version dans une nouvelle langue"; "remove language
    version" would be "Supprimer la version dans la langue courante".

  * "Authoring" was always translated with "rédaction"; "Authoring area"
    with "espace de rédaction".

  * Le terme "workflow" a été conservé en anglais; pardon pour l'entorse,
    mais "déroulement des opérations" gâche la concision des titres des menus!

creator: roku@apache.org
text:
The master key file is the english translation at the same time.
One will find the translation file(s) at

lenya/resources/i18n/cmsui.xml
lenya/pubs/@@pub@@/lenya/resources/i18n/cmsui.xml

Maybe the last one contains translations Olivier Lange was looking for.
It is a publication specific dictionary containing pub local messages like for
the "Create Document" screen.

Thanks for ur help :)

text:
I just sent an updated version of the french translation of the main and the
publication specific dictionaries.

This updated version replaces my previous attachment, which did not contain the
publication specific dictionary translation.

I reported some keys as missing in the main dictionary. As Rolf suggested, two
of them were present in the publication specific dictionary.

So I moved them from the main french dictionary to the publication specific
french dictionary. These are the keys:

keys = { "Create new language version",
"New language for existing Document" }

The other keys reported in my comment (Open translation issues) were not present
in the publication specific dictionary and are still missing.
